page.title: 17Fish Farming
page.content: The fish farm a mile from Presteigne breeds{rainbow trout}for sale.The water supply comes from the{River Lugg close to the farm.Several million gallons are needed to get enough {oxygen}in the water.The trout are fed on dried pelleted fish.To prevent baby fish dying they are watched carefully and the pools are netted to stop {herons}diving at them.The size,in weight of fish,which they start with, is about about a{hundred fish to the {lb.wt}.They are killed for sale from 8oz upward and sold at the{Birmingham {Wholesale Market}hotels,and to local people.The fish suffer from various {diseases,}including stress due to captivity.As a family concern,they do not want to over-expand nor turn the farm into a tourist attraction. Researched by Sarah Spencer,Sonia Mecke,Trinh Duong and Lisa Ash.
